definition: Ah Q, antihero of Lu Xun's influential 1921 novella The True Story of Ah Q 阿Q正傳|阿Q正传[A1 Q Zheng4 zhuan4]
abbr. for Afghanistan 阿富汗[A1 fu4 han4]
prefix used before monosyllabic names, kinship terms etc to indicate familiarity/used in transliteration/also pr. [a4]
cute (loanword)/(of food) having a pleasant chewiness (like mochi, tapioca pearls, taro balls etc – foods with a springy or gel-like mouthfeel)/(loanword) to cue sb
The True Story of Ah Q, influential 1921 novella by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]

sentences.english: Lu Xun's pursuit of the transmutation of human nature, his desire to become Qiu Jin Ah Q.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅追求的是人性的嬗變，他渴望的是阿Q變成秋瑾。

sentences.english: What Ah Q especially "hated bitterly" was his phoney pigtail.
sentences.chinese: 阿Q尤其“深惡而痛絕之”的，是他的一條假辮子。

sentences.english: I like Lu Xun’s works, especially The True Story of Ah Q.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡魯迅的著作，尤其是《阿Q正傳》。

sentences.english: I never believe palingenesis , this Ah Q was really the copy of the old one.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信轉世輪迴之說，但阿Q簡直老阿Q的複製品。

sentences.english: I never believe palingenesis , this Ah Q was really the copy of the old one.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信轉世輪迴之說，但阿Q簡直老阿Q的複製品。

sentences.english: Ah Q had always had the greatest contempt for such people as little nuns.
sentences.chinese: 小尼姑之流是阿Q本來視如草芥的。

sentences.english: Chapter two describes the cultural vacancy in Ah Q Zheng Zhuan.
sentences.chinese: 第二章闡釋《阿Q正傳》中的文化空缺現象。
